alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:27PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, southern Lake, northern Granite and northwestern Powell Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 127 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles south of Seeley Lake, or 22 miles east of Missoula, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seeley Lake, Potomac and Greenough. This includes the following highways... Highway 83 between mile markers 9 and 19. Highway 200 E between mile markers 9 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
